content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks in markdown
    code_blocks = Regex(r"`{3}(.+?)`{3}", RegexOptions.Multiline).findall(md)

    # Remove code fences and join the code blocks
    extracted_code = ""
    for block in code_blocks
        extracted_code *= "\n" * join(block, "\n"))  # Join with newline
    end

    return extracted_code
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a markdown document as input and extracts all Julia code blocks. It then removes the code fences and joins the code blocks together with a newline.

Please note that this function assumes that the input Markdown uses proper syntax for code blocks (i.e., triple backticks).
